verbs.description: electrocute (third-person singular simple present electrocutes, present participle electrocuting, simple past and past participle electrocuted)

examples: Her hairdryer fell into the tub while she was bathing, and she was electrocuted.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To execute by electric shock, often by means of an electric chair.
examples: The executioner threw the switch on Old Sparky, and the condemned prisoner was electrocuted for his crimes.

entries.meaning: (transitive, proscribed, informal) To inflict a severe electric shock (not necessarily fatal) upon.
